intro: Ceratopetalum gummiferum, commonly known as the gumtree or gum plant, is a shrub or small tree native to Australia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and evergreen leaves. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It is adapted to thrive in acidic soils and is often found in heathlands and coastal areas. The plant is also noted for its ability to exude a sticky gum, which gives it its common name.
